jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
Business Development Manager at Learnerbly
£30-40k per annum (£80k OTE)
**
Please apply through this link: **https://learnerbly.teamtailor.com/jobs/824629-business-development-manager

Learnerbly is a London based, VC backed Workplace Learning Platform which enables people to be their best selves at work​.  We're a team of entrepreneurs and innovators on a journey to redefine learning and development in the workplace. 

Our mission is to work with organisations to create a progressive learning culture that empowers their people to own their development, guides them towards the best learning opportunities and supports them in applying their learnings.  

We’re just getting started but so far we’ve already helped businesses like ustwo, carwow, GoCardless and IDEO to find the best learning opportunities to accelerate the growth of their people.

This role is based in London, we are hiring on a rolling basis.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

 - E2E Sales execution. Planning, Prospecting, Nurturing, Closing, Post Sales Support

 - Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and coordinate and drive the development of sales proposals

 - Maintain and build rapport with senior client executives to formulate strong, long term business relationships built on trust

 - Lead negotiation of prices and contracts, and understand legal ramifications of contracts

 - Maintain a thorough working knowledge of Learnerbly’s product and service offering, pricing structure, contract management parameters, policies and procedures

 - Develop and maintain a pipeline of targets - from top-of-funnel prospects to mature leads - and provide clear and accurate reporting of sales outcomes and activities

 - Develop and grow existing account relationships by deeply understanding how Learnerbly can partner best with our clients on an ongoing basis



REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:

These are ideal but not required as we know women are less likely to apply for the role unless they are 100% qualified (https://hbr.org/2014/08/why-women-dont-apply-for-jobs-unless-theyre-100-qualified). We promote a diverse, inclusive and empowering culture at Learnerbly.

- 3-10 years of SaaS sales or consulting experience, with personal and direct responsibility for revenue targets

- A thorough knowledge of the digital ecosystem as it applies to Learnerbly’s business and its clients’ activities and needs

- Experience and ability to manage complex and lengthy sales cycles

- The ability to identify client challenges, and develop creative solutions in close collaboration with clients

- The ability to effectively and persuasively communicate with C-suite leaders of scale-up businesses as well as FTSE 100 / 250 decision-makers

- A demonstrable track record of high performance

- Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiating skills

- Experience creating complex client proposals

- A self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to take responsibility for the full stack of business development development activities: you enjoy working as part of a small team, rapidly iterating on strategy, and roll up your sleeves to build something great

- Ability to speak a second European language a plus – French, German, and Spanish in particular.
 


WHAT OUR CLIENTS WANT:

- A consultative and thoughtful partner who can identify education-based solutions to business problems

- Someone who understands how startups as well as large organisations work

- Someone who doesn’t visibly “sell”, but instead guides clients through a complicated buying process


Benefits

- Competitive salary and results-driven bonus (£80k OTE)
- Open and inclusive working environment
- Values-driven culture
- £1000 learning and wellbeing budget to spend each year
- 25 days paid holiday
- Free on-site barista coffee, herbal teas and fresh fruit
- Quarterly team off-sites and outings
- Healthcare cashback scheme available 
- Flexible working environment/hours 
- Life insurance scheme available

Our Values

We look for people who share our values and can add to our culture. Values are shared beliefs that guide our decision-making, and culture is how we function as a group and how we live our values as individuals.

- Be your authentic self: For us, this means finding the intersection between what you love and what you’re good at, so you can be yourself at work.

- Set the destination, own the journey: "Be the change you want to see in the world." Think big, speak up, take ownership. We believe in learning by experimenting and failing fast: use your creativity and resourcefulness to find solutions to problems you encounter.

- Invite everyone to dance: “Diversity is being invited to the party, inclusion is being asked to dance.” We look for people who share our values and contribute to our culture. Diversity alone is not enough. We believe by being diverse and inclusive we make better decisions.

- Practice heartfelt, radical candor: We know seeking radically candid feedback can be hugely powerful. We proactively seek and give feedback to reveal blindspots and accelerate growth.

Find more about how we operate at Learnerbly with a menu à la carte: explore all or specific parts of our Employee Guide, a window into how we think and work compiling internal practices, and which we use as a living knowledge base: https://www.notion.so/learnerbly/Learnerbly-s-Employee-Guide-3a0964ee63aa490a8606fb7bebe42722

Please apply through this link: https://learnerbly.teamtailor.com/jobs/824629-business-development-manager

Content Curator, at Learnerbly, London

Given the current circumstances this role is 100% remote at the moment. 

22-25k per annum

*** PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK https://learnerbly.teamtailor.com/jobs/860886-content-curator?promotion=153590-trackable-share-link-learnerbly-website

Learnerbly is a London based Workplace Learning Platform that enables people to be their best selves at work.  

Our mission is to work with organisations to create a progressive learning culture that empowers their people to own their development, guides them towards the best learning opportunities and supports them in applying their learnings.  

We're looking for a Content Curator to join our team and assist in managing and curating the learning content within our platform. 

We are hiring on a rolling basis.

 

Responsibilities

At Learnerbly, a learning content is a piece of resource which a user would purchase to aid their development. The core responsibility is to assist in managing and curating this library of learning content within the platform.

Ensure all learning content on the platform meets our curation guidelines.
Ensure all learning content on the platform matches the tone and style of Learnerbly.
Maintain all learning content to ensure it is all up to date and accurate.
Work with Marketing to promote learning content across our marketing channels and social networks.
Work with Partnerships Lead to manage ongoing partnerships with learning providers and support the running of Learnerbly Events.
Work with Product to ensure backend continues to support the needs of the learning content on the platform from creation to ongoing maintenance.
Work with Operations to manage partner delivery processes to ensure learners receive their resources promptly and accurately.
 

Requirements

These are ideal but not required as we know some people are less likely to apply for the role unless they are 100% qualified. We promote a diverse, inclusive and empowering culture at Learnerbly.

BA in Journalism, Marketing, English, History, Social Sciences or related field.
Excellent written skills in English.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with the wider team.
Experience with data analytics platforms like Mixpanel, desirable.
Great organisational skills with the ability to work well under pressure and to tight deadlines.
Strong attention to detail.
A curious mindset.
Pro-active self-starter and enjoy working as part of a small team.
Hands-on experience with Content Management Systems (e.g. WordPress, Webflow), desirable.
 

Benefits

We’re passionate about learning and development and will do everything we can to maximise your personal and career growth. Check out our Employee Guide for more details!

jobs.description:
Marketing Manager
£30k – £40k

Learnerbly

London

We are growing rapidly and we're looking for a Marketing Manager to join our small team and drive the marketing activities within the company and grow our acquisition pipeline. You will be empowered by the autonomy to design, run and execute any marketing activities needed to generate more leads. This role is based in London.


Responsibilities

Drive lead generation, nurturing and conversion across organic and paid channels including PPC, SEO, email, social, website, offline events and others.
Identify, test and implement new B2B marketing channels and continuously evolve our marketing plan.
Management and optimization of the marketing budget.
Collaborate with Product in optimising positioning and messaging and engineer solutions to increase leads and conversion rates.
Design and implement tracking plans, reporting on marketing metrics.
Collaborate with sales and BD teams to optimise sales cycles, operations and processes.
Being hands-on with a wide range of analytics, marketing and automation tools.
This role will report directly into the Chief Revenue Officer.

- 2+ years experience in Marketing (experience in B2B, SaaS and/or EdTech is a major plus) 
- Focussed and creative problem-solver with a curious and technical mindset
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with the wider team
- Outcome focussed over output driven with a demonstrable track record of high performance

- Experience organising and running events marketing events, roundtables, seminars and symposiums
- Pro-active self-starter and enjoy working as part of a small team, rapidly iterating on approach and getting your hands dirty to deliver on the results


Benefits

- Competitive salary
- Open and inclusive working environment
